intro: Acritopappus teixeirae, commonly known as the Teixeira's acanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the dry regions of Brazil, where it thrives in sandy and rocky soils. The plant features prominent, spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers in composite inflorescences. It is characterized by its drought tolerance and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
